net.fathomsoft.nova.tree

Class Value

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.Node
      • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.Value
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Identifier, IValue

    public abstract class Value
extends Node
    Node extension that represents something that returns a value. For the rules on what can and cannot be an value node, refer to setType(java.lang.String)
    Since:
    v0.2.4 May 2, 2014 at 11:14:37 PM
    Version:
    v0.2.14 Jun 18, 2014 at 10:11:40 PM
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Method Detail

      • getReturnedNode

        public Value getReturnedNode()
        Get the node that returns a value. (Which is the specified node).
        Returns:
        Returns the specified Value.

      • getObjectReferenceIdentifier

        public java.lang.String getObjectReferenceIdentifier(CallableMethod methodDeclaration)
        Get the name of the object reference identifier for the given Method node. Static methods return "ClassName" and non-static methods return "this". The given method cannot be external.
        Parameters:
        methodDeclaration - The method to get the object reference identifier name from.
        Returns:
        The name of the object reference identifier.

      • getObjectReferenceNode

        public Identifier getObjectReferenceNode(CallableMethod methodDeclaration)
        Get the Value that the method was called with for the given MethodCall's method node, if it was not called with a specific object. Static methods return the ClassDeclaration and non-static methods return the "this" instance. The call cannot be that of an external method.
        Parameters:
        methodDeclaration - The method to get the Value from.
        Returns:
        The Value that the method was called with.

      • checkType

        public boolean checkType(java.lang.String type,
                boolean require)
        Check to see if the given Value type is valid. If it is not, this will throw an exception if it is required. If it isn't required it will return false. If it is valid, it will return true.
        In other words, check if the given String is a primitive type name or declared class name.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to validate.
        require - Whether or not throw an error if anything goes wrong.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the given value is valid.

      • isContainingClass

        public boolean isContainingClass(Value node)
        Check whether or not the given value is accessed within its direct parent class.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to check.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the node was accessed through its parent class.

      • isPrimitiveType

        public boolean isPrimitiveType()
        Get whether a variable's type is a primitive type or not.

        For the list of primitive values, see SyntaxUtils.isPrimitiveType(String)
        Returns:
        Whether a variable's type is a primitive type or not.

      • isPrimitive

        public boolean isPrimitive()
        Get whether a value is primitive or not. A value is primitive if it has a primitive type AND is NOT an array. Arrays are NOT a primitive type.

        For the list of primitive values, see SyntaxUtils.isPrimitiveType(String).
        Returns:
        Whether a variable is primitive or not.

      • isArray

        public boolean isArray()
        Get whether or not the variable is an array. A variable is an array if it has an array dimension of 1 or greater.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the variable is an array.

      • getArrayText

        public java.lang.String getArrayText()
        The text that represents an array in the C language.
        Returns:
        The text that represents an array in the C language.

      • isExternalType

        public boolean isExternalType()
        Get whether the type of the Value is external or not.

        For example: 
         external type FILE;
 
 FILE varName;
        In the code above varName's type of "FILE" is external.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the type of the valueNode is external.

      • setType

        public boolean setType(java.lang.String type)
        Set the type that this statement returns.

        For example: 
         private static int index;
        The type of the variable returns is "int"
        Parameters:
        type - The type that this statement returns.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the type was set successfully.

      • getTypeClass

        public ClassDeclaration getTypeClass()
        Get the ClassDeclaration that represents the type of the specified Value. If the type is primitive, this will return the wrapper class of the primitive type.
        Returns:
        The ClassDeclaration instance of the type.

      • getTypeClassName

        public java.lang.String getTypeClassName()
        Get the name of the class that represents the type of the specified Value. If the type is primitive, this will return the wrapper class name of the primitive type.
        Returns:
        The name of the class of the type.

      • generateNovaInput

        public java.lang.StringBuilder generateNovaInput(java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                                        boolean outputChildren)
        Description copied from class: Node
        Generate the Nova syntax String that represents the Node. Essentially, this is the String that is decoded into the node. It is the input value from the .nova source file.
        Overrides:
        generateNovaInput in class Node
        Parameters:
        builder - The StringBuilder to append the data to.
        outputChildren - Whether or not to output the children of the children of the Node as well.
        Returns:
        The appended StringBuilder that represents the input String in Nova syntax.
        See Also:
        Node.generateNovaInput(StringBuilder, boolean)

      • isVirtualTypeKnown

        public boolean isVirtualTypeKnown()
        Get whether or not the specified Node's type can be determined NOT to be virtual or not at compilation time, i.e. If the program doesn't have to use the vtable.
        Returns:
        Wether or not the type can be determined to NOT be virtual at compilation time.

      • getArrayDimensions

        public abstract int getArrayDimensions()
        Get the amount of dimensions that the array has, if any. For an example of what a array declarations and dimensions look like setArrayDimensions(int)
        Returns:
        The amount of dimensions that the array has, if any.

      • setArrayDimensions

        public abstract void setArrayDimensions(int arrayDimensions)
        Set the amount of dimensions that the array has, if any.

        For example: 
         int array[][][];
        In the previous example, the variable "array" has three dimensions.
        Parameters:
        arrayDimensions - The amount of dimensions that the array has, if any.

      • setType

        public abstract boolean setType(java.lang.String type,
              boolean require,
              boolean checkType,
              boolean checkDataType)
        Set the type that this statement returns.

        For example: 
         private static int index;
        The type of the variable returns is "int"
        Parameters:
        type - The type that this statement returns.
        require - Whether or not to throw an error if anything goes wrong.
        checkType - Whether or not to check if the type is valid.
        checkDataType - Whether or not to check the data type of the given type.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the type was set successfully.

      • getDataType

        public abstract byte getDataType()
        Get whether or not the identifier is a value, pointer, or reference.

        Possible values include:
        • Variable.VALUE - If the variable type simply refers to a value.
        • Variable.POINTER - If the variable type is a pointer.
        • Variable.REFERENCE - If the variable type is a reference.
        Returns:
        The data type that the variable is.

      • setDataType

        public abstract void setDataType(byte type)
        Set whether or not the identifier is a value, pointer, or reference.

        Possible values include:
        • Variable.VALUE - If the variable type simply refers to a value.
        • Variable.POINTER - If the variable type is a pointer.
        • Variable.REFERENCE - If the variable type is a reference.
        Parameters:
        type - The data type that the variable is.

      • test

        public static java.lang.String test()
        Test the Value class type to make sure everything is working properly.
        Returns:
        The error output, if there was an error. If the test was successful, null is returned.
